data.title: Plays
data.text: We buy season tickets and end up going to at least one of the shows and give them as xmas gifts. We have always had great times and the shows are always fun to watch. Never went to a show I didn't like

data.title: Excellent local Great Theater venue
data.text: Remodeled theater with newly redone seating.  Really not a bad seat in the house.  Most recently there for performance of "Sister Act" which was very well done.  Tip: arrive early to find parking then stop in next door at Jules Bistro for wine/beer and pizza before the show.

data.title: Great theater, friendly staff, awesome venue
data.text: A gem of a theater and arts venue!! Who knew such great talent and shows were available right here in St. Cloud

owner_response.author: Sara E, Guest Relations Manager at Paramount Center for the Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your response. I'm glad you enjoy our venue!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: The historical Paramouts theatre has a medley of attractions and activities.
data.text: Great sound effects in the historical theatre stage with a variety of local and nationally know performers. Gift shop with art by local artists. Classes offered for children and adults in a variety of disciplines.

owner_response.author: Sara E, Guest Relations Manager at Paramount Center for the Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: WOW!!
data.text: My cousin and I went to this theater for a concert for my birthday, and I loved it! It is a beautiful place, very elegant and a great venue for the music. I will come here again and again!

owner_response.author: Sara E, Guest Relations Manager at Paramount Center for the Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We're glad you enjoyed your visit. Hope to see you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Enjoyable
data.text:
enjoy their entertainment.  Use to go to Movies at the paramount as a teenager and young adult.
Great place for local entertainment

owner_response.author: Sara E, Guest Relations Manager at Paramount Center for the Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Glad you have enjoyed the Paramount in past years and continue to enjoy it!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Paramount performances
data.text: The best feature of this venue is the talent they are able to bring to Central Minnesota.  To name a few, Clint Black, Arlo Guthrie and Judy Collins.  The theatre has been beautifully restored, and is now a highlight of downtown St. Cloud.

data.title: Home free concert
data.text: Beautiful place clean nice friendly staff meet a young man from home town now working there.  All staff were very friendly and kind we will come back again. History is reflected in the awesome structure.

data.title: Very Happy
data.text: Very fun afternoon spent watching a local play at the theater. Play was well done, location is all right, the parking can be a problem. There is a ramp that leads to the theater. Could be hard to find coming from out of town. Locals should have no problem. You are only a few feet from two very good places to eat, Jules Bistro and White Horse. Try them both, if you can only do one, go to the White Horse first.

data.title: Classic Theater !
data.text: We have been to the classic old theaters in New York City and Chicago but the Paramount Theater has them beat !----it is so nicely restored---the seats have plenty of leg and butt room, the acoustics terrific and the ushers are so very helpful. We will be back for out first experience at the Paramount exceeded our expectations!

data.title: Great fun at renovated theatre
data.text: Saw the play "Grease" last weekend.  Thoroughly enjoyed the play but the threatre itself make the performance so much more fun.  The attention to detail in the historically accurate renovation made the performance so much more fun.

data.title: very nice venue
data.text: very very nice place for a concert in a small setting ,accostics are great and the new seats are nice as well .

data.title: Great Jem in St Cloud
data.text: This restored, historical theatre is an excellent venue.  There is a wide variety of performances to pick from.  The new seats are comfortable, the sound system and viewing are excellent and the ticket prices reasonable.  Pick something you like from their varied performance schedule. You wont be disappointed.

data.title: comfortable and relaxing
data.text: Beautiful classic theater with small art gallery in hallways, portable bars with tables/chairs to relax at while waiting for your event to start. Seats very cushy and comfortable, wider than most venues so our shoulders weren't scrunched up! Will be happy to visit here again!

data.title: The Place To Go
data.text: Excellent venue with excellent performances.  Enjoyed a Christmas performance in the new seats; comfortable with seating spaced perfectly to view the stage.  Pricing is very reasonable for the level of talent the Paramount is able to bring in.  Add a dinner at one of the nearby small restaurants and it makes a perfect evening.

data.title: Historic, Restored Theater
data.text:
There aren't a lot of theaters in St. Cloud, but if you've never been to The Paramount for a play or concert or other event, it's certainly worth the time. Since its restoration, the painting, and the addition of new seats, it's really quite beautiful and captures an era gone-by. It's a fun venue for entertainment. We've sat along the side balcony, in the rear balcony, and on the main floor. While we've never had a bad seat, I will say that the acoustics, particularly for some of the plays, hasn't always been terrific.

The Paramount also has an adjoining art gallery/lobby, an additional art gallery in the basement, and utilizes space across the street for an art gallery as well.

Going to The Paramount will give you a feeling of attending an event in a theater of old. It's a fun place to visit.

data.title: Exceeded expectations
data.text: We attended the rock and roll Christmas spectacular here. We were very impressed with the music as it exceeded our expectations. We were here with the group from my workplace and many people commented on how great of a show it was. There is some historical significance to the building and it is a good venue to attend shows at. There is a great variety of wonderful bars and restaurants nearby which are also worth visiting. This place is worth the drive to try out one of their shows.

data.title: Great Venue
data.text: This historic theater has been restored and is a great venue for events. We saw The Rock and Roll Christmas Spectacular here. We were upper left balcony and had a great view. Seats were comfortable with ample leg room. Long lines for the small bathrooms. The beverage lines were long, but moved quickly. I would not hesitate to attend another event here.

data.title: St Cloud's Cultural and Entertainment spot
data.text: The Paramount offers a WIDE range of shows, classes, exhibits and is an overall meeting place for culture starved outstate Minnesotans. If they have a performance happening, it's probably worth checking out.  Support of places such as the Paramount is vital to the community, as well as to the cultural diversity of central Minnesota's alternative to the Twin Cities arts and entertainment scene.  It isn't the Walker or the Guthrie, but we love what they bring to our part of the world!  Break a leg!  ;}

data.title: Beautifully Restored Theater with Excellent Productions
data.text: Attended a concert performed by the L.A. Guitar Quartet... fantastic performance.  The theater originally opened in 1921.  My wife grew up in Saint Cloud and remembers attending moving screenings in the 50's and 60's and remembers the theater sometimes had bats flying around the high ceiling.  No bats any more.  The restoration's during the 90's upgraded the theater beyond its original magnificence and gave attendees a superb venue for a wide variety of programs.  Highly recommend you check out the current and upcoming shows - prices are very reasonable.
